subsection.title: Basic properties of determinants
subsection.p: The following justifies our definition of the determinant as the common value of all cofactor expansions of a matrix.

statement.p: Every cofactor expansion of a given square matrix, whether along a row or a column, evaluates to the same value.

proof.p: The proof of this theorem is beyond the scope of this course; instead see .

subsection.p: Finally, let's record the determinants of special forms of matrices we discussed in . However, we omit the proofs since we have already considered in detail the patterns behind the proofs in that earlier discussion.

ol.li: For a matrix that is diagonal or triangular, the determinant is equal to the product of the diagonal entries.
